results.title: Cloud over Ohio
results.creator_credit: Edward Plumb, Karl Maslowski and S O H I O
results.brief_description: In spite of a high annual rainfall, the state of Ohio, USA has faced severe droughts. This film illustrates the part played by water in the daily lives of the inhabitants, also its use in industry and agriculture, then probes for reasons behind the apparent wastage of water resources. Draws particular attention to wastage of both soil and water resulting from soil erosion. Includes close-up shots of rain drops striking unprotected soil, showing the extent and nature of the damage caused.

results.title: Clothing. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: Hermann D. Tauchert and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film combines animation and live-action to outline the variety and purpose of clothing. The development of fabrics from the early use of grasses, leaves, skins and furs is followed by scenes from early film clips showing industrialisation in textile-making and the manufacturing of synthetic fibres and cloth. Includes footage showing the mass production of jeans (Levi Strauss). Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Clotheslines
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary which focuses on laundry as an aspect of women’s lives and work in the home. The film is composed largely of tales and memories, and through the acts of hanging, folding, arranging, ironing and placing laundry in drawers, “Clotheslines” demonstrates how these have become symbolic actions for mothering, living properly and, most of all, providing a sense of security.

results.title: Clockwork
results.brief_description: Looks at the introduction of time and motion study principles to what has occurred in the workplace, particularly highlighting the work of Frederick Winslow Taylor. Shows the effects of the application of these studies to the employment situation and the way in which technology has made redundant many skilled occupations of the past. Useful in looking at changes in the workplace.

results.title: Coal Miner's Daughter
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Bernard Schwartz and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the autobiography of the same name by country and western legend Loretta Lynn, the film traces her beginnings in the Appalachia backwoods, her marriage when still a child, and her eventual arrival in Nashville. From there she launches her career and becomes one of America’s most successful recording artists. The film is notable for its evocative depiction of poverty in the Deep South, and the winning portrayal of Lynn by Sissy Spacek (who won an Academy Award for her role). Cast also includes Tommy Lee Jones, Levon Helm and Beverly D’Angelo in a cameo as Patsy Cline. The soundtrack features a selection of country and western classics.

results.title: Co Hoedeman: animator
results.creator_credit: Nico Crama, Barrie Howells, Henk Suer, Tom Daly, National Film Board of Canada and Nederlandse Omroep Stichting
results.brief_description: Academy Award-winning filmmaker, Co Hoedeman, divides his time between family, farm, and studio. This film, while showing all three aspects of his life, places particular emphasis on his work as an animator. He is shown working on a short animation clip, created especially for the film. Excerpts of his films are shown. Voice and narration by Richard Gilbert. (Award: Montreal)

results.title: Co for kids
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Dorothy Courtois, Gaston Sarault, Joseph Koenig, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Three works from multi-award winning Canadian director/animator Co Hoedeman. All are silent apart from the musical effects. 1.”Tchou tchou” (1971, 14 mins): A children’s fantasy where painted building blocks represent a make believe city and the two children who play in it until an angry dragon appears on the scene. Themes of play, friendship, threat, fear, attack, defence, failure, inventive solutions, outwitting and success are supported by evocative music and sound effects to create a lively and optimistic “narrative”. 2.”The Sand Castle”, (1977, 13 mins): Set in an horizonless sand landscape, a sandman sculpts mythic like creatures from sand. Under his direction they build a wonderful sandcastle. Celebrating its completion they are interrupted by an uninvited, naughty guest. The wind blows strongly and each scrambles for shelter in the fragile sandcastle which becomes enveloped by sand, its outlines crumbling, leaving us where we began in the sand landscape. Interpretations are left to the mind of the viewer. (Awards: Winner of 22, including an Academy Award and a Melbourne International Film Festival Award) 3.”Matrioska”, (1970, 4.5 mins): A set of Russian Babushka dolls are used as a group of dancers who separate, merge, separate in a series of arrangement themes (eg. smallest to largest, youngest to oldest) to create a choreography. Minute differences of painted expressions, supported by action and music give character to each of the dolls.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Co Hoedeman, Dorothy Courtois, Gaston Sarault, Joseph Koenig, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Panic time
results.brief_description: This slow build suspenseful short efficiently builds anticipation through a series of very polished point-of-view shots The scene is set with a mysterious girl in an anonymous hotel room.
